qas.question: About how many bison were in Montana in 1870?
In 1884 about how many bison remained?
Who pleaded to Congress for slaughtering bison?
What year did General Sheridan approach Congress about killing bison?

context: Simultaneously with these conflicts, bison, a keystone species and the primary protein source that Native people had survived on for centuries were being destroyed. Some estimates say there were <a0_0>over 13 million<a0_0/> bison in Montana in 1870. In <a3_0>1875<a3_0/>, <a2_0>General Philip Sheridan<a2_0/> pleaded to a joint session of Congress to authorize the slaughtering of herds in order to deprive the Indians of their source of food. By 1884, commercial hunting had brought bison to the verge of extinction; only <a1_0>about 325<a1_0/> bison remained in the entire United States.
